conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B and C. Predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.

D and E are the containers that receive the liquid.
Stream A hits the orange slanted barrier and changes its flow direction to the right.
Stream B hits the orange slanted barrier and changes its flow direction to the right.
Stream C hits the grey slanted barrier and changes its flow direction to the left.

premise: The liquid from A changes its flow direction to the left after passing through the red barrier.
conclusion: The liquid from A will eventually merge with the liquid from B and C.

conclusion: The liquid from B and C will eventually merge with the liquid from A at the brown baffle.
